p: Apart from the commercialized products, a recent study in 2017 reported on the potential of a novel, non-fastidious freshwater microalgae ( Chlorella emersonii KJ725233) for possible application in cosmeceuticals accounted by its anti-ageing, antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties. Its ability to inhibit elastase, hyaluronidase, collagenase and to scavenge free radicals supports skin tissue that gives rise to skin rejuvenation. In addition, phytol compounds, shown to reduce the proteinases activity and thus, reduces the dermis inflammation [ 141].
